title: â€˜Mia and the White Lionâ€™ Producers Set New Family Adventure â€˜Indiana and the Otterâ€™s Legend,â€™ Playtime Launching Project at AFM (EXCLUSIVE)
description: The team behind global family hits â€œMia and the White Lionâ€ and â€œThe Wolf and the Lion,â€ Mediawanâ€˜s Mai Juin Productions, is heading back into the w
body:
The team behind global family hits â€œMia and the White Lionâ€ and â€œThe Wolf and the Lion,â€ Mediawanâ€˜s Mai Juin Productions, is heading back into the wild with â€œIndiana and the Otterâ€™s Legend.â€  

	Set to shoot in the wilds of Canadaâ€™s Eastern Townships in 2026, the English-language family adventure project has been boarded by Playtime, the Paris-based company which is part of Vuelta.  


	Playtime (â€œThe Quiet Sonâ€) is launching worldwide sales for the ambitious project at the American Film Market, marking its first collaboration with Mai Juin Productions.
	

	Following the journey of animals and children set against against a lush backdrop, â€œIndiana and the Otterâ€™s Legendâ€ has already secured distribution partners in major territories, including another Vuelta-affiliated banner, Pan Distribution in France, as well as Mediawanâ€™s Leonine Studios in Germany, and Photon Films and TVA Films in Canada.

	The new movie will be directed by Julien Decoin, best known for the acclaimed French drama series â€œLes Bracelets Rouges,â€ and written by Cynthia Knight, whose youth-focused credits include the series â€œThe Next Step.â€ 

	Marguerite Laurence, who was seen in Amazonâ€™s â€œThree Pines,â€ stars in a first lead role as 12-year-old Indiana (Laurence), who is â€œuprooted from the city to the struggling riverside town of Otterville â€” once famous for its otters, now hauntingly without them. When two unexpectedly return, the town dares to hope again. But protecting them leads Indiana and her friends into a battle against a predatory developer, a corrupt mayor, and her own father â€” the town sheriff,â€ reads the synopsis. 
	

	Mai Juin Productionsâ€™ Catherine Camborde, the driving force behind the animal-led family hits, â€œMia and the White Lionâ€ ($40M), â€œThe Wolf and the Lionâ€ ($25M) and â€œThe Last Jaguarâ€ ($22M), is producing  â€œIndiana and the Otterâ€™s Legend,â€ alongside Wishing Tree Productionsâ€™ Jonathan Vanger and Sylvain Proulx, whose credits span â€œCat & Dog,â€ â€œBest Sellers,â€ and â€œCrisisâ€. The project is backed by Telefilm Canada.

	â€œOtters as the main characters are highly engaging,â€ said Playtime Co-CEO SÃ©bastien Beffa. â€œThey bring an imaginary background of positive values such as family and work, but also tenderness, humor, and genuine empathy.â€

	Beffa also praised the script for offering an â€œauthentic ecological perspective, not in a guilt-inducing way but in a constructive manner, allowing audiences of all ages to get involved in an entertaining way.â€

	Camborde and Vanger, meanwhile, said theyâ€™re â€œdelighted with this first partnership with Playtime.

	The pair described â€œIndiana and the Otterâ€™s Legendâ€ as â€œan adventure film in the spirit of â€˜E.T.,â€™ â€˜Super 8,â€™ â€˜The Gooniesâ€™ and â€˜Stranger Things,â€™ featuring a group of children and otters.â€ The producers said the film will combine â€œadventure, emotion, and comedy thanks to the mischievous nature of the animals,â€ and universal themes such as â€ friendship, teenage emancipation, environmental protection.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Mia and the White Lionâ€™ Producers Set New Family Adventure â€˜Indiana and the Otterâ€™s Legend,â€™ Playtime Launching Project at AFM (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Disney Store Revs Up F1 Partnership With First-Ever Racing-Inspired Merch and Apparel Collection
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Disney is
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Disney is going full throttle into Formula 1. As part of the newly announced multi-year â€œFuel the Magicâ€ collaboration between the two global powerhouses, Disney Store is debuting its first F1-themed capsule collection this week â€” a 25-piece drop that blends the prestige of the motorsport with the legacy characters of Mickey & Friends.

	Launching Nov. 8 online at DisneyStore.com and in person at the F1 Las Vegas Hub inside the Venetian Resort, the line serves as the first consumer product expression of the Disney-F1 deal, which will roll out across content, experiences and merchandise through the 2027 season.
	


						
			
	

	
					

	Designed by Disney Consumer Productsâ€™ in-house team and led by Bobby Kim â€” the former Hundreds co-founder who now serves as VP of Creative â€” the collection adopts a red, black and white palette shared by both Mickey Mouse and Formula 1. Apparel, accessories and collectibles lean into racing cues: checkerboard trims reinterpreted as fashion accents, track-shaped graphics, athletic silhouettes and an aerodynamic, slightly edgier version of Mickey built specifically for this universe. â€œHe was meant to look fast,â€ Kim tells Variety. â€œNot retro, not nostalgic â€” more sleek, more premium, more in line with the F1 aesthetic.â€


	That balance of heritage and futurism also appealed to Formula 1â€™s Las Vegas team. â€œThis isnâ€™t just merch â€” itâ€™s an F1 lifestyle line,â€ Collette Gangemi, VP of Consumer Products for the Las Vegas Grand Prix, said in a statement. â€œWe wanted the adrenaline and prestige of the sport, the neon energy of Vegas and the universal charm of Disney, all in one collection.â€
	

	The launch is timed to the sportâ€™s splashiest U.S. stop: the Las Vegas Grand Prix, where Mickey & Friends will make an appearance during a special pit-lane walk for select grandstand ticket-holders. Itâ€™s one of several activations planned under the â€œFuel the Magicâ€ banner, a campaign Disney and F1 say is designed to bring fans â€œcloser to the magicâ€ through race-week programming, premium product and crossover storytelling.

	â€œIâ€™ve always admired F1 from afar,â€ Kim says. â€œBut once youâ€™re inside it, you understand: itâ€™s rock-star-driven, high-stakes, global, fast â€” literally and metaphorically. And Disney, at its best, moves just as fast.â€

schema.headline: Disney Store Revs Up F1 Partnership With First-Ever Racing-Inspired Merch and Apparel Collection

title: ITV in Talks to Sell Networks Arm to Comcast-Owned Sky for $2.1 Billion
description: U.K. broadcaster ITV has confirmed it has received a Â£1.6 billion ($2.1 billion) bid from Comcastâ€™s pay-TV platform Sky for its media and entertainm
body:
U.K. broadcaster ITV has confirmed it has received a Â£1.6 billion ($2.1 billion) bid from Comcastâ€™s pay-TV platform Sky for its media and entertainment unit. 

	The shock news â€”Â which would fundamentally change the British broadcasting landscape if it were to go ahead â€”Â would see Comcast take control of ITVâ€™s linear channels and ITVX streaming business, significantly expanding its U.K. TV foothold, having already acquired Sky for around $30 billion in 2018. 
	

	According to news reports, the bid from Sky centers on the potential creation of a U.K.-focused streaming giant.


	In a short statement sent Friday morning, ITV said it noted â€œthe recentÂ pressÂ speculation and confirms that itÂ is in preliminary discussionsÂ regardingÂ aÂ possibleÂ saleÂ ofÂ itsÂ M&EÂ business to SkyÂ for an enterprise value of Â£1.6bn.â€

	It added: â€œThere can be no certainty as to the terms upon which anyÂ potential saleÂ may be agreed or whether any transaction will take place. A further announcement will be madeÂ in due courseÂ ifÂ appropriate.â€

	The discussions do not include ITVâ€™s production and sales arm, ITV Studios, which makes shows including â€œLove Island,â€ â€œIâ€™m a Celebrityâ€ and the drama â€œMr Bates vs The Post Officeâ€ and has been the center of numerous recent takeover rumors. RedBird IMI and Banijay are understood to have expressed an interest in the unit.

	Despite only being preliminary, the idea of a sale of ITVâ€™s TV business to Sky â€”Â which would require regulatory approval â€” has sent the U.K. broadcasting world into a spin. 
	

	â€œITVâ€™s proposed Â£1.6 billion sale of its Media & Entertainment division to Sky could mark a turning point for British television,â€ said Giao Pacey, partner and corporate lawyer at media and entertainment law firm Simkins LLP. â€œItâ€™s not just a divestment, itâ€™s a sign that U.K. broadcasters are rethinking how they operate in a fast-moving media landscape. By offloading its traditional TV channels and streaming service ITVX, ITV is aiming to reduce its reliance on advertising, which can be unpredictable, and instead focus on producing content it can sell globally.â€

	Confirmation of the deal talks came shortly after ITV reported that it would â€œtemporarilyâ€Â shave $46 million from its budgets over the U.K.â€™s â€œsoftening economyâ€ and advertiser uncertainty. It said it expected ad revenues to fall by 9% in the key fourth-quarter period in the lead up to Christmas. 

	ITV shares jumped 18% at the start of trading in London on Friday following news of a potential deal with Sky.

schema.headline: ITV in Talks to Sell Networks Arm to Comcast-Owned Sky for $2.1 Billion

title: â€˜Female Teacher: Forbidden Sexâ€™ Among Selections as Rotterdam Spotlights Japanâ€™s V-Cinema Movement
description: The International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR) has unveiled its second Focus program for the 55th edition, turning the spotlight on Japanâ€™s V-Cine
body:
The International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR) has unveiled its second Focus program for the 55th edition, turning the spotlight on Japanâ€™s V-Cinema â€” the direct-to-video movement that exploded in the late 1980s and profoundly shaped the countryâ€™s contemporary film culture. 

	The section, curated by Tom Mes, will run as part of the festivalâ€™s 2026 edition from Jan. 29 to Feb. 8.


	Originating with Toeiâ€™s â€œCrime Hunter: Bullets of Rageâ€ (1989), V-Cinema responded to Japanâ€™s booming home video market by producing films that bypassed theaters entirely. The low-budget, high-speed production model gave directors unprecedented creative freedom, birthing a generation of filmmakers who went on to define modern Japanese cinema â€” including Miike Takashi, Nakata Hideo, Kurosawa Kiyoshi and Aoyama Shinji.
	

	IFFRâ€™s V-Cinema Focus will showcase a range of Toei titles, among them the â€œCrime Hunterâ€ trilogy â€” â€œCrime Hunter: Bullets of Rage,â€ â€œCrime Hunter 2: Bullets of Betrayalâ€ and â€œCrime Hunter 3: Killing Bullet.â€ The lineup also features Nakataâ€™s debut feature â€œFemale Teacher: Forbidden Sex,â€ the psychological noir â€œBetrayal Tomorrow,â€ and the cult action thriller â€œXX Beautiful Weapon.â€


	The program expands beyond Toei to highlight the anarchic spirit and genre experimentation that defined the movement. Among the selections are the ghostly anthology â€œScary True Stories: Second Night,â€ the eerie found-footage investigation â€œPsychic Vision: Jaganrei,â€ and Miikeâ€™s hyperviolent â€œFudoh: The New Generation.â€ Other highlights include the surreal gangland fable â€œTuff: Part I,â€ Kurosawaâ€™s deadpan yakuza comedy â€œSuit Yourself or Shoot Yourself!! VI: The Hero,â€ Aoyamaâ€™s archetypal action drama â€œA Weapon in My Heart,â€ and â€œThe King of Minami,â€ about a loan shark aiding small business owners.
	

	â€œV-Cinema offered filmmakers the space to take risks, move fast and work with a freedom rarely possible within the traditional studio system,â€ said IFFR festival director Vanja Kaludjercic. â€œWhat emerged was a wild and inventive cinema embracing everything from anarchic yakuza tales and psycho-horror experiments to surreal hybrid pieces â€” work that still feels electric today.â€

	IFFRâ€™s full 2026 program will be unveiled on Dec. 16.

schema.headline: â€˜Female Teacher: Forbidden Sexâ€™ Among Selections as Rotterdam Spotlights Japanâ€™s V-Cinema Movement

title: â€˜Wicked: One Wonderful Nightâ€™: 9 Things You Didnâ€™t See on TV, Including Multiple Takes of â€˜Defying Gravityâ€™
description: Oz may have told us to pay no attention to the man behind the curtain, but at the Dolby Theatre taping of â€œWicked: One Wonderful Night,â€ audiences w
body:
Oz may have told us to pay no attention to the man behind the curtain, but at the Dolby Theatre taping of â€œWicked: One Wonderful Night,â€ audiences were treated to a rare peek at the magic behind the scenes.

	The show was recorded at the Dolby Theater on Sept. 24 with a packed audience of â€œWickedâ€ fans dressed for the occasion.

	Plenty of standout moments made the broadcast â€” including a duet of the Judy Garland-Barbra Streisand classic â€œHappy Days Are Here Again/ Get Happy,â€ performed by film stars Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo â€” but some of the eveningâ€™s most delightful off-camera momentsÂ didnâ€™tÂ make the final cut.Â 
	

	Here are a few things youÂ didnâ€™tÂ see on air:Â 

	
		Audience ParticipationÂ Â 	

	Before cameras rolled, the audience was enlisted to learn choreography for the opening number, â€œNo One Mourns the Wicked.â€ Those seated in the orchestra section were given faux tulips and taught the flower choreography from the film â€” tossing them into the air on cue, timed to Grandeâ€™s entrance as Glinda the Good. The group rehearsed for several minutes before dancers joined for a final run-through and filming.Â 
	
		The Show Must Go OnÂ 	

	The sequences were filmed out of order and included full musical numbers along with the scene-to-scene transitions. While most numbersÂ requiredÂ only a single take, a few â€”Â including â€œThe Wizard and Iâ€ and â€œDefyingÂ Gravityâ€ â€”Â were performed twice to secure a clean version, giving the audience an extra encore. Grande and Erivoâ€™s duet of â€œHappy Days Are Here Again/ Get Happyâ€ also received an extra run-through â€” not for technical reasons, but simply because the pair wanted to â€œdo it again.â€Â 
	
	
		Multiple Choice MomentsÂ 	

	Along with taping alternate versions of musical performances, the production also recorded multiple intros for the showâ€™s packaged segments. At one point, director Jon M. Chu filmed two separate setups: one introducing a segment of unseen audition tapes from actors â€œwho tried out for the filmâ€ including Khloe Kardashian, Shaquille Oâ€™ Neal and Ludacris, and another teasing a new, exclusive clip. Only the unseen auditions made the broadcast, suggesting the other wasÂ ultimately cut.Â 
	
		The Teaseâ€¦ Without the PayoffÂ 	

	Throughout the night, Grande, Erivo, and the cast teased exclusive looks at new film clips and musical moments â€” but the live audienceÂ didnâ€™tÂ end up seeing them. At one point, Grande and Erivo introduced the new songs premiering in the film and set up a â€œfirst listen,â€ only for no clip to appear.Â Â â€œWeâ€™re sorry, you wonâ€™t actually hear them tonight!â€ Grande apologized. â€œIsnâ€™t that evil? We said that!â€ Erivo chimed in, adding, â€œThat was not our fault. We want to give you everything â€” we love you!â€Â Â Later, Bowen Yang and Ethan Slater teased a performance of â€œFor Goodâ€ pre-recorded at the Gershwin Theatre, where â€œWickedâ€ lives on BroadwayÂ â€”Â only to reveal the audienceÂ wouldnâ€™tÂ be seeing it. The room responded with playful groans.Â â€œSorry, guys!â€ Yang said.

	The broadcast version featured a â€œWickedâ€ reunion of Idina Menzel and Kristin Chenoweth, who first played the characters in the original Broadway production and made a cameo in the first film. Grande and Erivo were also on stage and the four were accompanied by composer and lyricist Stephen Schwartz on piano.
	
		The EmceeÂ Â 	

	During downtime, Bill SindelarÂ was tasked with emcee duties and kept spirits high. He updated the crowd on the run ofÂ show, mingled with audience members â€” even inviting those in elaborate costumes to the front to show them off â€”Â and helped guide the taping of audience reaction shots and B-roll.
	
		Fun Between ScenesÂ Â 	

	The taping stretched over four hours, with breaks between scenes as production reset for the next setup. During those pauses, music kept the crowd energizedÂ â€”Â from Chappell Roanâ€™s â€œPink Pony Club,â€ which sparked a full-blown sing-along, to â€œHot to Go!â€ which resulted in an emcee-ledÂ danceÂ session. Later, when â€œThank U, Nextâ€ began playing, Grande surprised the crowd by popping back onstage, laughing as she shared a quick moment with the audience.Â 
	
	
		Marissaâ€™s MomentÂ 	

	Marissa Bode, who plays Nessarose, introduced â€œDefying Gravityâ€ with a speech about authenticity and resilience.Â â€œThis song is an ode to authenticity and about believing in yourselfÂ â€”Â no matter what obstacles the world puts in your way,â€ she said. The broadcast version cut to her intro; however, Bode added: â€œWhether it be school bulliesâ€¦ or power-hungry dictatorsâ€¦â€Â whichÂ prompted a loud, sustained cheer in the room. Though the line was removed for the broadcast, the ovation lastedÂ nearly 30Â seconds live.Â 
	
		â€˜Popularâ€™	

	In a surprising turn of events, Grande picked an audience member to perform opposite with, instead of her usual scene partner Erivo as Elphaba. The lucky audience member happened to be a young 4-year-old boy named Remington. Remington was dressed as Elphaba, complete with a broom prop. Grande placed him down on the bed and danced and sang her way through the song, interacting with him. There were no unexpected surprises there. Grande and her newest co-star performed â€œPopularâ€ in one take. And yes, she did give him his broom back.

	Choreographer Christopher Scott revealed he had stood in for the child during rehearsals. â€œIt was me and Ari, and Iâ€™m pretending to be this 4-year-old child. In my mind, Iâ€™m thinking, â€˜I donâ€™t know what a 4-year-old child is going to do.'â€ Backstage, Scott was watching the monitors, having mini celebrations every time something worked.
	
		â€˜Dancing Through Lifeâ€™	

	Peopleâ€™s sexiest man alive, Jonathan Bailey, wasnâ€™t available the day the show taped. â€œThey were trying to move mountains to make it happen,â€ Scott told Variety.

	Once the team knew it wasnâ€™t going to happen, the team came up with various ideas to try to represent the number on the show. Scott said, â€œWe wanted to honor Jonathan, and honor the show, and give the fans something fresh and new that was fun for them.â€

	Enter Bowen Yang as Fiyero. â€œIt opened up this opportunity to see another side of him,â€ said Scott. And they werenâ€™t done yet â€” Slater and Bode also got to don Fiyeroâ€™s outfit and dance through life.

schema.headline: â€˜Wicked: One Wonderful Nightâ€™: 9 Things You Didnâ€™t See on TV, Including Multiple Takes of â€˜Defying Gravityâ€™

title: Thai Girlsâ€™ Love Drama â€˜Love Designâ€™ Acquired by Cappu Films at Taiwan Creative Content Fest (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Hong Kong sales company Cappu Films has picked up Thai Girlsâ€™ Love series â€œLove Designâ€ and is introducing the title to buyers at the Taiwan Creativ
body:
Hong Kong sales company Cappu Films has picked up Thai Girlsâ€™ Love series â€œLove Designâ€ and is introducing the title to buyers at the Taiwan Creative Content Fest (TCCF), which is currently taking place.

	GL and BL (Boysâ€™ Love) series, which center on same-sex romantic relationships, have become a popular genre across Asia, with Thailand emerging as a major production hub for such content.


	Under the arrangement, Cappu Films and VelCurve Studio â€” the production company behind the sci-fi film â€œUranus 2324â€ â€” will jointly handle international sales for Japan, Korea, Taiwan, Vietnam, North America, Latin America and Singapore.
	

	Helmed by Fuse Kittisak Cheewasatjasakun, the series follows two female architects, portrayed by Kao Supassara Thanachart and Jane Methika Jiranorraphat, whose romantic relationship deteriorates into professional animosity after one uses the otherâ€™s designs in a competition without permission.


	The show debuted Oct. 2 with weekly Thursday releases. Thailandâ€™s Channel 3 is airing an eight-episode version, while Tencentâ€™s WeTV platform carries an extended cut with 10 episodes. Fan events for the final two episodes are planned for early December 2025.

	Keetawat Chinnakote, CEO and executive producer at VelCurve Studio, and Janice Woo, founder and head of sales at Cappu Films, negotiated the agreement.

	â€œâ€˜Love Designâ€™ is a GL series that tells the story of the architecture profession â€” exploring both the challenges of work and the romantic relationships of its characters,â€ said Keetawat. â€œIt stars the talented Kao Supassara and Jane Methika, alongside promising newcomers Friend Tofan and Palm Paramee. Produced by VelCurve Studio, the series is crafted with a strong commitment to high production standards and storytelling that allows global audiences to easily understand and connect with its context and emotions.â€
	

	He characterized the series as Thai soft power content that showcases the countryâ€™s creative capabilities internationally, noting his hopes for global audience support through the Cappu Films partnership.

	â€œAt Cappu Films, we are passionate about bringing distinctive Asian stories with global resonance to audiences worldwide,â€ said Woo. â€œâ€˜Love Designâ€™ is a bold and emotionally layered GL series that combines romance, rivalry, and ambition in a fresh way. Partnering with VelCurve Studio allows us to champion diverse storytelling while tapping into the phenomenal energy of the GL fan community across Asia and beyond.â€

	Cappu Films handles international sales for emerging directors and commercial genre content. The companyâ€™s TCCF slate features the Busan Vision competition winner â€œMalikaâ€ from Kazakhstan, the action-thriller â€œFox Huntâ€ with Tony Leung Chiu-wai and Olga Kurylenko, Josh Radnorâ€™s â€œAll Happy Families,â€ the Karlovy Vary entry â€œPromise, Iâ€™ll Be Fineâ€ from Aerofilms/Filmtopia, and the Chinese action title â€œAssassin,â€ which Film Movementâ€™s Omnibus Entertainment label will distribute in North America.

	VelCurve Studioâ€™s previous work includes â€œUranus 2324,â€ which Netflix acquired for its streaming service throughout Southeast Asia, covering Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Brunei, Cambodia, Laos, East Timor, Vietnam, the Philippines, Myanmar and Indonesia.

schema.headline: Thai Girlsâ€™ Love Drama â€˜Love Designâ€™ Acquired by Cappu Films at Taiwan Creative Content Fest (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Rod Blackhurstâ€™s Horror Film â€˜Dollyâ€™ Lands Distribution Deal With Shudder, Independent Film Company Ahead of AFM (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Shudder and Independent Film Company have closed a deal for Rod Blackhurstâ€˜s horror film â€œDollyâ€ covering North American, U.K., Ireland and Australi
body:
Shudder and Independent Film Company have closed a deal for Rod Blackhurstâ€˜s horror film â€œDollyâ€ covering North American, U.K., Ireland and Australia-New Zealand territories, with plans for a theatrical release next year.

	The film centers on Macy, a young woman fighting to survive after being taken by a monstrous figure intent on raising her as its child. Critics have noted its blend of New French Extremity aesthetics with 1970s American horror sensibilities.
	

	The ensemble includes Fabianne Therese, Seann William Scott, Ethan Suplee, Russ Tiller, Kate Cobb and Michalina Scorzelli. Former NWA TV Champion Max the Impaler, also known as The Non-Binary Nightmare, makes their film debut in the title role.


	The Witchcraft Motion Picture Company production, which earned strong reviews at Fantastic Fest and Sitges Film Festival, marks another genre project for Blackhurst, the Emmy and Critics Choice-nominated filmmaker behind â€œBlood For Dustâ€ and Netflixâ€™s â€œAmanda Knoxâ€ documentary. He also co-wrote Universal and Blumhouseâ€™s â€œNight Swimâ€ with Bryce McGuire.

	Blackhurst wrote the screenplay with Brandon Weavil. Ross Oâ€™Connor produces alongside Noah Lang and Blackhurst through Witchcraft Motion Picture Company, with Set Point Entertainment, Grim Discoveries, Gentile Entertainment Group, Monarque Entertainment and Mama Bear Studios attached. Additional producers include Joseph P. Grano, Betty Tong, Esteban Sanchez, McGuire, Isaiah Smallman and cast members Therese, Scott and Suplee.

	Samuel Zimmerman negotiated the acquisition for Independent Film Company and Shudder, while Blue Finch Films represented the filmmakers.
	

	Steven Schneider, whose credits include â€œParanormal Activityâ€ and â€œInsidious,â€ executive produces with Matt Patterson, Barry Large, Bobby Campbell, Sinan Germirli, Scorzelli, Rudy Mawer, Cam Doody, Jared Houghton, Travis Truitt, Anthony and John Gentile, Mike Chapman, Fatima Hayward, Antonio Dâ€™Intino, Lawrence Dossche and John Neumann.

	â€œâ€˜Dollyâ€™ is a grotesque, beautiful backwoods nightmare,â€ said Zimmerman, senior VP of programming and acquisitions. â€œRod Blackhurst and team transcend their influences to create a beguiling, terrifying new monster; one to love and definitely fear.â€

	â€œâ€˜Dollyâ€™ is both the exact kind of relentless uncompromising genre filmmaking we grew up loving and a testament to what Witchcraft as a studio understands is possible and most important right now; creating original IP and making films that audiences want,â€ added Blackhurst. â€œTruly independent, thematically rich, and created with care and craft. â€˜Dollyâ€™ is here to stay and we are excited for everyone to see the first chapter in an expansive horrifying universe.â€

	Witchcraft Motion Picture Companyâ€™s slate includes Amblinâ€™s â€œThe White Room,â€ Carter Smithâ€™s â€œSwallowed,â€ Peacock series â€œJohn Wayne Gacy: The Devil in Disguiseâ€ and Independent Spirit Award nominee â€œThis is Not a War Story.â€ The company is prepping Blackhurstâ€™s action thriller â€œDie By Nightâ€ while completing post-production on sci-fi film â€œInto the Sky,â€ starring Sam Richardson and David Cross, and drama â€œRuby Road,â€ executive produced by Rosario Dawson.

	Blue Finchâ€™s international lineup includes Fantasia selections â€œHellcatâ€ and â€œHold The Fort,â€ plus horror sci-fi â€œAffectionâ€ with Jessica Rothe.

schema.headline: Rod Blackhurstâ€™s Horror Film â€˜Dollyâ€™ Lands Distribution Deal With Shudder, Independent Film Company Ahead of AFM (EXCLUSIVE)

title: â€˜Stranger Things 5â€™ First Five Minutes Revealed: Young Will Byers Battles Vecna in the Upside Down After 1983 Disappearance
description:
The first five minutes of the final season of â€œStranger Thingsâ€ have been revealed.

	After the Season 5 premiere in Los Angeles on Thursday night,
body:
The first five minutes of the final season of â€œStranger Thingsâ€ have been revealed.

	After the Season 5 premiere in Los Angeles on Thursday night, Netflix surprise dropped the clip on YouTube, which takes viewers all the way back to the beginning of the series after the 1983 disappearance of Will Byers (Noah Schnapp). 

	Titled â€œThe Crawl,â€ the first episode opens on a young Will in the Upside Down, trying to calm himself down by softly singing the Clashâ€™s â€œShould I Stay or Should I Go.â€ Suddenly, a Demogorgon attacks, chasing Will up a tree and leading to a gnarly fall. Knocked unconscious, Will is then dragged by the Demogorgon to the lair of Vecna (Jamie Campbell Bower). Wrapping Will up in his vines with one over his mouth, Vecna says creepily: â€œAt long last, we can begin. You and I, we are going to do such beautiful things together.â€
	

	Volume 1 of â€œStranger Thingsâ€ Season 5 is set to drop on Nov. 26, with Volume 2 debuting on Dec. 25. The series finale will premiere on Dec. 31. 


	â€œThe fall of 1987. Hawkins is scarred by the opening of the Rifts, and our heroes are united by a single goal: find and kill Vecna,â€ the synopsis for Season 5 reads. â€œBut he has vanished â€” his whereabouts and plans unknown. Complicating their mission, the government has placed the town under military quarantine and intensified its hunt for Eleven, forcing her back into hiding. As the anniversary of Willâ€™s disappearance approaches, so does a heavy, familiar dread. The final battle is looming â€” and with it, a darkness more powerful and more deadly than anything theyâ€™ve faced before. To end this nightmare, theyâ€™ll need everyone â€” the full party â€” standing together, one last time.â€
	

	Watch the first five minutes of â€œStranger Things 5â€ below.

schema.headline: â€˜Stranger Things 5â€™ First Five Minutes Revealed: Young Will Byers Battles Vecna in the Upside Down After 1983 Disappearance

title: â€˜Quererâ€™ Co-Writer JÃºlia de Paz Solvas Unpacks â€˜The Good Daughter,â€™ One of the Big Catalan Highlights at Tallinn
description:
â€œMy parents didnâ€™t just argue,â€ Carmela confides in her best friend at school, her face darkening. But she doesnâ€™t go into detail.Â 

	â€œHave you ever
body:
â€œMy parents didnâ€™t just argue,â€ Carmela confides in her best friend at school, her face darkening. But she doesnâ€™t go into detail.Â 

	â€œHave you ever seen your dad act violent? Has he ever treated your badly?â€ a judge asks Carmela later in the film, in a crux scene caught in a new teaser trailer for â€œThe Good Daughter,â€ from Catalan JÃºlia de Paz Solvas. The teaser does not capture Carmelaâ€™s reply.


	Sold by Beta Cinema, The Good Daughterâ€ world premieres in main competition at the Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival, which runs Nov. 7-23. It begins with Carmela meeting her father in a secured room to ensure he will not meet her mother, who drops her off. Julia loves both parents, idolizes her father, who is preparing an art exhibition, wants to remain loyal to him, whatever he does, whatever her own cost.Â 
	

	What he does do to Carmela, in psychological and physical terms, exacts a tremendous emotional toil on her, which she tries to bear in silence.Â 

	Co-written with NÃºria DunjÃ³ Lopez (â€œAma,â€ â€œJone Sometimesâ€), â€œThe Good Daughterâ€ marks the second feature by De Paz Solvas, aÂ VarietyÂ 2021 Spanish Talent to Track whose debut â€œAmaâ€ won â€¦. She leapt to much further prominence this year for co-writing â€œQuerer,â€ which won this year the top Grand Prix at Series Mania, Europeâ€™s biggest TVÂ Â festival.




	There have been any films on gender violence but â€œwhatâ€™s most notable about â€˜The Good Daughterâ€™ is without doubt its viewpoint. The cinema I like most are films that present viewpoints that Iâ€™d never really thought about before,â€ says Sergio Grobas, the filmâ€™s producer at Barcelona-based Astra Pictures, which co-produced with Madridâ€™s Avalon Pictures and Belgiumâ€™s Kratin Films.Â Â 
	

	VarietyÂ sat down with De Paz Solvas in the run-up to the Black Nights Films Festival, where â€œThe Good Daughterâ€ is one of the big highlights among new films, at a Focus on Catalonia, dedicated by Tallinn Festival at a territory which has taken festivals by storm while emerging as a extraordinarily fertile co-production force in Europe and Latin America.Â 

	The teaser youâ€™ve chosen to publish withÂ VarietyÂ drives at the heart of the film: its exploration of gender violence from a not-so-often-considered angle of a daughter? How did you come to explore it?

	If we want to talk about an issue, Nuria, the filmâ€™s co-screenwriter, and I always begin by research, which in this case took more or less four or five years. I wanted to explore gender-based violence. So we began to interview its victims, survivors. Talking with them, we realized that the large majority were hugely worried about their children which in a large majority of cases were not considered victims since they hadnâ€™t suffered direct physical nor sexual violence from the abuser, their father. As a militant feminist, I was surprised I hadnâ€™t thought about thisâ€¦ .Â  Â 

	The sons and daughters donâ€™t receive psychological counselling?

	At both a judicial and social level when itâ€™s a case of psychological violence, itâ€™s difficult for it to be considered violence since itâ€™s subtler, if I can use that description. Since there isnâ€™t evidence which proves violence, which can be the case with physical or sexual abuse, itâ€™s more difficult for it to be considered violence. What we found is that the Spanish justice prioritises the role of the pater families, the father, rather than the figure of an abuser.

	And you talked to the children of victims of gender-based violence?Â 

	Yes, the mothers asked their children â€“ who were normally around the age of Carmela in the film â€“ if they wanted to be interviewed. We interviewed sons and daughters, letting them talk about what they were comfortable about. What they said enriched the screenplay. Also the screenplay was revised by RaÃºl Lizana,Â Â one of Spainâ€™s leading authorities on vicarious violence â€“ when an aggressor who does not have direct access to the woman he wants to harm exercises that violence on significant persons for her.Â 
	

	Did you interview aggressors?

	We met with men who had been jailed for gender-based violence. Itâ€™s very easy to fall into clichÃ©s. We wanted to show they are not always monsters but have cycles of violence which means that at times they can be spontaneous, seductive, that there are moments of light. We wanted to create this sense of duality of the moments when Carmela is with her father, and in a certain way enamoured of him. Weâ€™d like spectators to understand that thereâ€™s no specific figure of a victim of gender-based violence, that itâ€™s far more complicated that we are given to believe.

	In the filmâ€™s first half-hour or so, you understand that the father has been guilty of gender-based violence but you donâ€™t see it. That builds tension and suspense.â€¦Â 

	Yes, thereâ€™s a certain similarity with â€œQuererâ€: That spectators have to fill in the gaps and be asked to doubt a kind of violence which isnâ€™t that clear. In the scene at the swimming pool, itâ€™s not quite totally clear if this was a game that theyâ€™d just seen. In â€œQuerer,â€ for example, we didnâ€™t want to show the husbandâ€™s attacks but rather the post.Â Â 

	What were your guidelines as a director?Â 

	I wanted to follow Carmela at every moment, without judging her, and also that the film would travel between darkness and light, a light captured for example in the relationship with her friends or with the first kiss. We also wanted to play with spaces. I asked Victor Santacana, our art director, to work in a way that, even if Carmela wasnâ€™t in a space, she would be for the spectator.Â Â 

	And do you sense that you form part of a a new generation of Catalan filmmakers who have broken trough in the last 10 years and are often women?

	At a conscious level, maybe not so much but itâ€™s true that I feel part o0f a network which weâ€™ve all built together. Eva Libertad (â€œDeafâ€),Â Â Gemma Blasco (â€œLa Furiaâ€), or Sara Fantova of â€œJone, Sometimesâ€ are my friends. Iâ€™ve grown up with them. If I have questions Iâ€™ll ask the or other friends. For example, Alauda Ruiz de AzÃºa, writer-director of â€œQuerer,â€ helped me with the editing of â€œThe Good Daughter.â€ We have this support network between us.Â Â  Â

schema.headline: â€˜Quererâ€™ Co-Writer JÃºlia de Paz Solvas Unpacks â€˜The Good Daughter,â€™ One of the Big Catalan Highlights at Tallinn

title: Manoj Bajpayee Returns as Hunted Spy in Prime Videoâ€™s â€˜The Family Manâ€™ Season 3 Trailer (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Prime Video has unveiled the trailer for the third season of its hit spy-thriller series â€œThe Family Man,â€ with Manoj Bajpayeeâ€˜s iconic character Sr
body:
Prime Video has unveiled the trailer for the third season of its hit spy-thriller series â€œThe Family Man,â€ with Manoj Bajpayeeâ€˜s iconic character Srikant Tiwari now finding himself on the run from both new adversaries and his own intelligence unit.

	The trailer was unveiled at a fan and media event in Mumbai on Friday, previewing the series created by Raj & DK under their D2R Films banner. Season 3 sees Srikant racing against time to protect himself, his family and the nation from an imminent threat, with the hunter now becoming the hunted.
	

	â€œFor the past four years, fans have hounded me with the question, â€˜When is Srikant Tiwari coming?â€™ And we finally have the answer with a new season thatâ€™s not only bigger, bolder, and more exciting but also raises the stakes higher than ever for Srikant, as he finds himself cornered with no respite in sight,â€ said Bajpayee. â€œThanks to Raj and DKâ€™s vision and masterful storytelling, and the continued support of Prime Video, â€˜The Family Manâ€™ has become one of the most-loved Indian series.â€


	The latest season introduces two formidable new adversaries: Rukma, played by Jaideep Ahlawat (â€œPaatal Lokâ€), and Meera, portrayed by Nimrat Kaur (â€œThe Lunchboxâ€). 

	â€œI have always admired Raj and DK for their creative abilities and bringing to life a series like â€˜The Family Man,â€™ which has become one of the most watched and loved Indian series all over the world, and I am thrilled to be a part of the latest season,â€ said Ahlawat. â€œWithout giving away much about my character, I am certain that everyone will be surprised to see me portraying this role.â€
	

	The series is written by Raj, DK and Suman Kumar, featuring dialogues by Sumit Arora. Raj & DK direct alongside Suman Kumar and Tusshar Seyth, who join as directors for Season 3.

	Kaur, who described herself as a fan of the series since Season 1, called joining the show â€œa dream come true.â€ â€œPlaying Meera was both thrilling and challenging, as I had to match the caliber and performative brilliance of Manoj and Jaideep,â€ she said. â€œAnd the way Raj, DK, and Suman have crafted the story with its rich characters and unpredictable twists, I believe audiences will want to binge the new season in one go.â€

	The explosive trailer showcases the seriesâ€™ signature elements including witty dialogues, high-octane action, thrilling chases and the blurred lines between Srikantâ€™s personal and professional life. In Season 3, Srikant must navigate life on the run with his family while being pursued by TASC, his own intelligence unit, in addition to the new threats.

	â€œSeason 3 of â€˜The Family Manâ€™ turns Srikantâ€™s covert professional and fragile personal life upside down, as he is forced to go on the run with his family while facing an even more alarming threat in Rukma and Meera,â€ said creators, directors and writers Raj & DK. â€œBoth Jaideep and Nimrat are the perfect choice, as actors and personalities to embody these dynamic and menacing foes, testing not only Srikantâ€™s grit and resolve but also his commitment to his family and his nation. Taking the story several notches higher the new season will grip audiences with its edge-of-the-seat tension and nail-biting moments as they witness their favorite spy navigating uncharted territories and peril.â€

	Returning cast members include Sharib Hashmi as J.K. Talpade, Priyamani as Suchitra Tiwari, Ashlesha Thakur as Dhriti Tiwari, Vedant Sinha as Atharv Tiwari, Shreya Dhanwanthary as Zoya and Gul Panag as Saloni.

	â€œThe Family Manâ€ Season 3 will premiere exclusively on Prime Video on Nov. 21 in India and over 240 countries and territories worldwide.

	Watch the trailer here:

schema.headline: Manoj Bajpayee Returns as Hunted Spy in Prime Videoâ€™s â€˜The Family Manâ€™ Season 3 Trailer (EXCLUSIVE)

title: David Harbour, Millie Bobby Brown Attend 'Strangers Things' Premiere Amid Drama
description:
David Harbour, Millie Bobby Brown
                          Not So Strange at Premiere ...
body:
David Harbour, Millie Bobby Brown
                          Not So Strange at Premiere ...
                          Amid Bullying, Harassment Claims
                      
                  
                        Published November 6, 2025 7:05 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
          The "Strangers Things" cast got together Thursday night in Los Angeles for the premiere of the Netflix show's final season ... and David Harbour and Millie Bobby Brown were notably seen not only arriving together, but posing for some pics -- amid some serious allegations she reportedly made against him.
      
    
      
      David Harbour and Millie Bobby Brown arrive together for one last Stranger Things premiere ğŸ¥¹ pic.twitter.com/zjzcPi9Zv4â€” Netflix (@netflix) November 7, 2025
              @netflix
          
  
    
          There has been speculation that this occasion would feel sorta strange -- being the premiere comes on the heels of reports about Millie allegedly filing a bullying and harassment complaint against David -- but MBB was all smiles as she is seen being playful with her co-star of now 5 seasons.
      
    
          The actress reportedly filed the alleged complaint before she started filming the final season with David, so one could predict that they would avoid each other at all costs ... but the pair are leaving the rumors in The Upside Down.
      
    
          We reached out to reps for Millie and David ... so far no word back.

title: Bianca Censori Shows Off Butt In Thong Bodysuit at Airport

Bianca Censori
                          I'm Ready For The Mile High Club
body:
Bianca Censori
                          I'm Ready For The Mile High Club
                      
                  
                        Published November 6, 2025 5:57 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Bianca Censori never takes a break from showing off her body in public, even when she's dealing with air travel.
      
    
          Check out these photos of Kanye West's wife at an airport in Melbourne ... she's wearing an all-black look comprised of a thong bodysuit and heels.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Lots of folks travel comfortably, but not Bianca ... she's keeping things stylish and sexual ... which, as you are well aware by now, is kind of her thing.
      

          Bianca had a big purse with her as she stopped by the ticketing counter ... but she wasn't traveling light ... she's got plenty of baggage, if you know what we mean.
      
    
          We saw Bianca wear some other revealing outfits this week while she was visiting her family Down Under, and this one's more covered up than those ... but she's still showing off her curves ... as is tradition.

title: Elsa Hosk Hot Shots to Kick Off Her 37th Bday!
description:
Elsa Hosk
                          It's My Birthday ...
                          Check Out My H
body:
Elsa Hosk
                          It's My Birthday ...
                          Check Out My Hot Shots!!!
                      
                  
                        Published November 7, 2025 12:01 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
              
    
    
          Swedish supermodel Elsa Hosk turned 37 today, and to kick off the party we're throwin' her hottest shots your way!
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The Victoria's Secret angel is aging like a fine wine, and she's as hot as ever.
      
    
          Her hot shots check all the boxes ... there's lots of photos of her in revealing swimwear at the beach and at the pool ... and don't forget her tasteful nudes, including a mirror selfie where she's covering up her private parts with her hands.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Elsa's pics will drive you crazy, but don't get any ideas ... she got engaged a couple months ago to her longtime beau, Tom Daly, and they have a daughter, Tuulikki, together.
      
    
          Click through the gallery ... Elsa's got plenty of birthday cake to go around.
